channel.title: South Pole on David Lilien

item.title: Advection and non-climate impacts on the South Pole Ice Core
Holocene Ice‚ÄêFlow Speedup in the Vicinity of the South Pole
2018 South Pole Field Season
item.description: I’m freshly back from another field season in Antarctica. This was a quick one, with only about two weeks down at the South Pole, though with transit I was gone for just over a month. We were continuing GPS and radar surveys, logging boreholes, and checking on instruments that had overwintered.

item.title: 2017 SPICEcore Meeting
item.description: I attended the annual meeting of the scientists who work on the South Pole Ice Core (SPICEcore) last week, which was a great opportunity to learn about all the work that people are doing using the core. This meeting was held at the University of Washington, September 19-20, 2017, and had scientists from throughout the US in attendance.

item.title: South Pole Geophysics
item.description: Investigating ice flow upstream of South Pole
